data.title: Board of Directors
data.meta_description: Meet the leaders of the Novato Chamber. The Novato Chamber Board of Directors is responsible for setting policy and for over 100 years, the Board and has worked to give the North Bay business community a strong voice in order to help develop the local economy.
data.text:
The Novato Chamber is governed by a Board of Directors. Our board are dedicated individuals who enjoy living/working in the community that they serve. They come from unique backgrounds and bring with them years of industry wisdom as well as dedicated to see this community thrive. Board members are eager to participate and help shape a better tomorrow for region.

Novato Chamber Board members serve 3-year terms and may serve two consecutive terms before they must take a mandatory year-off from service. This term limit helps ensure that new leadership and ideas come to the Board and the Chamber. Chamber Presidents may serve one or two year terms.,Â

Coree is an Enrolled Agent with more than thirty years of experience in the fields of accounting and taxation.

Over the course of her professional career, Coree has advised countless individuals and small businesses as well as prominent concerns such as Columbia Hospitals, Kendall Jackson Wine Estates, and In Bed Productions, Inc., producers of Dancing with the Stars.

Prior to becoming one of the founders of Cameron Coffey & Kaye in 2003, Coree managed her own successful bookkeeping and write-up practice serving clients throughout San Francisco, Marin and Sonoma Counties.

In addition to her work at Cameron Coffey & Kaye, Coree is also Treasurer of Novato Community Television, Rotary Club of Ignacio, and Novato Community Action Network, Inc. (formerly Novato Womenâs Network, Inc.), a not-for-profit organization that she formed in 2009, which focuses on helping the Novato community throughÂ charitable donations, fundraisers, and partnerships with other local not-for-profit organizations.Â Her organization has raised over $75,000 for local causes.

Coree feels duty-bound to support the Chamber and the community that it represents (and that she loves). Her ideals and viewpoints are aligned with the Chamber, which enables her to offer powerful insights into business and community goals and support the mission and values of the Chamber.

Sherri Jacobs, Â has a dual role at Valley Memorial Park as Director of Finance as well as Director of Marketing.Â Valley Memorial Park provides full service, Cemetery, funeral home on-site crematory andÂ reception center--the most unique business of its type in all of Marin.

In addition to successfully raising two children, Sherri has over twenty-five years in the business community that included managing her own company for over 15 years and then successfully migrating to a corporate position with the Napa Wine Train while continuing to closely volunteer her services with a variety of non-profit organizations.Â Although only being a member of the Novato Community for a few years, Sherri has continued to pursue her life-long passion of supporting programs vital for the success and vitality of our community of family, friends, and businesses.Â Â Her take action personality and ability to see what needs to be done and create the time and energy to find ways to get things done for so many organizations, businesses and individuals is one of her many assets.Â Sherriâs genuine passion for supporting our community is one of her greatest strengths.Â Â Changing the way, the community looks at our type of business.Â Bringing our company forward to be a viable part of the community.

Sherri brings 8 years of working with non-profits on boards.Â Enthusiasm and a vision for helping our chamber to move forward in Shaping tomorrow.Â Â

Denise Athas served on the Novato City Council for 13years from 2009 to 2022 and was Mayor for 3 times.Â She retired from politics in December of 2022. Â Â Denise has been very active in the Novato community in various leadership capacities.Â In the past she has served as President of the Novato Chamber of Commerce in 2002, President of Downtown Novato Business and served on the state board of directors for the League of CA Cities for 4 years and served as President of the Northbay Division of League of CA Cities and President of the MCMCC (Marin County Mayors & Council Members.

Denise is a native Californian, raised in the East Bay, and has two grown sons, Matthew and Joe.Â Denise has been a Residential Real Estate Agent for 35 years, is a Broker, and for the last 14 years has run her own boutique real estate company with her husband George Athas which is Athas & Associates Real Estate Inc. located at 1202 Grant Avenue in the heart of Downtown Novato.Â Please visit www.DeniseAthas.com for more info.

Denise served on the Board of Directors of the Chamber in the early 2000âs and is excited and honored to be serving on the Board of Directors currently.

Denise can be reached at 415-245-2959 or DAthas@aol.com

A graduate of San Francisco State University in Interdisciplinary Creative Arts-majoring in Educational Administration and minoring in music performance. Continued my education in their masters program and at the same time studied at College of Marin inÂ their music performance and teaching programs. My music endeavors led me to electronics and then electronics sales.

Since 2011 I have enjoyed being a real estate agent and part owner of Athas & Associate Real Estate, a residential real estate brokerage on Grant Ave. in downtown Novato. Prior to joining the company, I (as well as many,) spearheaded the start of Canon USAâs Video Division, and spent more than 20 years with this fantastic company.Â My territory stretched over eight states and achievements included yearly sales awards with one being the top National Sales Award winner.

I was born in Marin and have spent over 40 years living in Novato. Since 1995 I have been married to my wife Denise and we have two sons, both professionals living in Sacramento.

Over the years I have served as Chair of the Chamber Golf Committee , volunteered on the Sutter Hospital Golf Committee and the Novato City Birthday Party Committee, where for the last five years, I headed up the âTaste of Novatoâ part of the event.

Some of my passions are photography, music, gardening, food, and travel!

I am honored to now serve on the Board of Directors of the Novato Chamber of Commerce.

Stacey Beckhardt joined BioMarin in 2015 and now serves as Senior Director, Global Advocacy Strategy and Operations, Government Affairs.Â BioMarin is a global biotechnology company that develops and commercializes innovative therapies for patients with serious and life-threatening rare and genetic diseases.Â The company has strong roots in Novato since its founding there in 1997.Â Novato is the site of its manufacturing and many of its research facilities.Â Other Marin offices are located in San Rafael.

Staceyâs role at BioMarin is about building alliances, always with an eye toward strengthening the companyâs commitment to the local community as well as to partner with advocacy groups with common interests in public policies that have an impact on people living with rare and genetic disorders.Â Stacey has worked in the pharmaceutical industry for more than 16 years.Â Previously, she spent nearly two decades representing non-profit medical and scientific societies and foundations.Â Stacey received an MS in experimental psychology from Villanova University, and a BS in psychology from the University of Virginia.

A prior Novato Chamber Ambassador for several years, Mr. De Ramon currently promotes the Novato Chamber and its purpose by serving on the Chamber Board. Expectations include shared fiduciary oversight of the Novato Chamber, enlisting new members, maintaining relationships with current members, and serving as a goodwill representative at local nonprofits, business and community activities. Richard will also develop new business contacts in Novato while increasing community-wide recognition for both the Chamber and First Federal Savings.

Richard was recognized as the Novato Chamberâs Ambassador of the year in 2016. âServing and improving the community whenever possible is greatly valued at First Federal Savings. Moving our loan and administrative offices to Novato allowed me the opportunity to once again to serve in Novato.â

A graduate of San Francisco State University, Richard has more than 30 years of financial services experience with positions in both California and Florida. Prior to joining First Federal, Mr. De Ramon was employed in retail management positions with Bank of Marin and Redwood Credit Union. Community Service: Past committees and board involvement include: San Rafael Education Committee, Novato Human Needs Center, Marin Y Board, San Rafael Chamber Ambassador Committee, Novato Chamber Ambassador Committee, Novato Sunrise Rotary. Richard is a San Francisco native, now residing in Marin with his life partner, Lisa, a physician for Marin Health. Interests include traveling, art, and music (especially Jazz).

Iâm a CPA and co-owner of Jannisse & Hull CPAs in Novato.Â I became a CPA Â because I love helping people understand their taxes and accounting.Â I became a CPA later in life, after spending many years doing accounting and payroll for various companies, and eventually getting my B.S. from UC Berkeleyâs Haas School of Business. But once I learned how to do tax planning and prepare tax returns, I never looked back.Â I love a good challenge â like messy books or tax returns not filed for multiple years.Â I also love helping small nonprofits too.Â I grew up in Novato (go Hornets!) and live in Larkspur.

Having played Minor league baseball in my prime youth years, and a current active yoga enthusiast, it helps me to be a strong, conscious, present, and compassionate negotiator. I utilize the latest technology, social media, and television while marketing your home through competitive insight. With a typical response time of 24 hours or less, you will feel comfortable knowing your questions and concerns are being answered or worked on. Having my Brokers license and some lending background, I can help you every step of the way to see the big picture with your real estate portfolio. A portion of my sales goes to a local nonprofit called launch five for five that helps to struggle Millenials, usually, 18-30 years of age get on their feet to have a great resume and kick start their careers. Specialties: My area of expertise are with First Time Home Buyers, Investors, and Seniors SRES (Senior Real Estate Specialist) Designation as of 1/21/2018

Board Member with the Novato Chamber and 2018-2019 Leadership Novato Graduate

Marin Builders Association Member 2019

Michael is a networker and connector in the Novato Community while supporting the Chamber with multiple Membership signups through telling my experience with the Novato Chamber.Â

Kevin Jacobs is a Construction Consultant after retiring from over 40 years as a Commercial Construction Superintendent and Project Manager. Kevin has been a resident of Novato for over 39 years and has a true love for the community. He had his own construction company in Novato from 1996-2002. He was then and continues to be a faithful Chamber Member and Ambassador.

He has completed the Novato Leadership program in 2001, along with being a member of the Rotary Club of Novato Sunrise.

He is currently on the Novato Design Review Commission and serves as their chair.

The first Board of Directors he was on was in San Bruno at Tanforan Shopping Center from 1977 to 1980.

He is now very involved in the local community and supports many nonprofit events.

His hobbies include Classic Cars (actually Trucks), Fishing (spending much time at Marinâs reservoirs) and traveling.

Homa Rassouli is a licensed Reverse Mortgage Specialist at Mutual of Omaha Mortgage with over 38 years of experience in the reverse mortgage field, including 22 years in the financial services and mortgage industries at Wells Fargo Bank and Mutual of Omaha. Homa has been the recipient of the prestigious "President's Club" honor for the past 16 consecutive years and is a trusted name in the industry, know as a reliable resource for retirees.

She has been honored with providing numerous trainings, seminars and panel discussions to deliver matter of fact information and learning knowledge to groups ranging from Novato and San Rafael Chambers of Commerce, Financial Planning Association, the National Association of Insurance and Financial Advisors and the Marin Bar Association to name a few. Homa is also active engaged with The Marin Realtors, North Bay Realtors, Women Council of Realtors, CAL CPA, and Section on Aging.

She additional serves on the Novato Chamber Board of Directors, Marin Council Estate Planning Council, San Francisco Financial Planning Association, Marin Realtors Government Affairs Committee, San Rafael Women on Industry Committee and Women's Club of Marin.

Homa enjoys educating and working with mature homeowners, their families and their trusted advisors to secure long-term sustainable solutions.

Homa holds a Bachelor of Business Administration in Management and Finance from Gannon University, PA. She spends much of her free time with her family, especially her three grandchildren: Sofia (14), Ellie (10), and Sebastian (8)

Tom young-Â co owner of Pini Hardware â serving Novato since 1918- Novatoâs oldest retail business. Tom young is third generation owner of Pini Hardware along with his brothers Russ and David. The young family has owned the store since 1968. Pini is celebrating its 105th year in 2023.

Tom lives in Sonoma with his 2 sons Scott and Travis. But actually, feels like he lives in Novato. When not dealing with the day-to-day operations of running a family run store he enjoys other activities. Trying to attend as many events as he can. He is currently a board member on the Novato Chamber of Commerce and when has time a member of the Novato Rotary Club. Tom also is head coach and area director for the Sonoma Valley Special Olympics- and when he can tries to coach soccer with friends and former players he has coached for almost 40 years.

Pini Hardware won the Large Business of the Year in 2018 and received the Spirit of Marin Award in 2019.

Tom is one of the leaders of the fabulous 4th of July parade Pini Plunger Patrol and is a supporter of many events such as schools- scouts both boys and girls- sports groups and teams- holiday tree lighting- 4th of July parade- just to name a few.

Tom is all about the community- loves to give back- as he and his brothers know that without the community there would be no Pini Hardware. We consider Pini as the community store.
